page.title: 13RECREATION - COMPUTERS
page.content: In our survey of 90 people questioned in Harbury, we found that 64% had a home computer. Of these 30% owned the Sinclair Spectrum due to its competitive price, the plentiful software available and its reliability. The second choice was the BBC micro with 20% of the market. It, like the Spectrum, also has a lot of games, the main supply coming from Acornsoft. The 3rd most popular is the Electron, the BBC's smaller "brother". Nobody owned a computer 4 years ago in Harbury. 52% said that they had had their computer less than one year. 90% of people preferred games rather than educational programmes. The most popular games were Chuckie Egg, Elite, Hopper, Ghostbusters and Pacman. Chuckie Egg was the favourite because it was available for lots of computers.
